Justification: To rule out any fractures or structural abnormalities in the neck following the minor fall.
To assess for any soft tissue injuries, such as disc herniation or ligament damage, especially given the persistent pain and limited range of motion.

Investigation: CT scan of the cervical spine (if MRI is contraindicated)
Justification: To provide detailed imaging of the cervical spine and rule out any serious underlying conditions.
To check for any signs of infection or inflammation that could be contributing to the neck pain.
To assess the range of motion and develop a rehabilitation plan to address the stiffness and discomfort.
